Getting it right-with well-conceived rules, data, and methodologies-helps to avoid time-consuming regulatory disputes and contract renegotiations, reduce regulatory capture by the new private operator, and assess who gains and who loses from utility privatization. Getting it wrong can cause the concessionaire to operate and invest inefficiently, raise its cost of capital, and ultimately jeopardize privatization. This Note outlines the accounting requirements that a regulator should impose on new concessionaires to navigate these waters as smoothly as possible.
